question1.en: Do you have any siblings?
question1.ja: 兄弟や姉妹はいますか？

answer1_variations.en: Yes, I have an older brother and a younger sister.
answer1_variations.ja: はい、兄と妹がいます。

answer1_variations.en: No, I'm an only child.
answer1_variations.ja: いいえ、一人っ子です。

answer1_detail.en: Being the middle child is tough sometimes.
answer1_detail.ja: 真ん中の子は時々大変なんだよ。

question2.en: Do you get along with them?

answer2_variations.en: We used to fight, but we're close now.
answer2_variations.ja: 昔は喧嘩したけど、今は仲良しだよ。

answer2_variations.en: Not really, we are very different.
answer2_variations.ja: そうでもないかな、性格が全然違うから。

question1.en: Who do you look like more, your mom or dad?
question1.ja: お母さんとお父さん、どっちに似てる？

answer1_variations.en: Everyone says I'm the spitting image of my dad.
answer1_variations.ja: みんな、私が父に瓜二つだと言うよ。

answer1_variations.en: I have my mother's eyes.
answer1_variations.ja: 目は母譲りだね。

answer1_detail.en: But personality-wise, I'm more like my mom.
answer1_detail.ja: でも性格的には、母に似てるかな。

question2.en: Does your brother look like you?
question2.ja: お兄さんはあなたに似てる？

answer2_variations.en: Not at all, people don't believe we're related.
answer2_variations.ja: 全然、みんな私たちが親族だとは信じないよ。

answer2_variations.en: Yeah, we could pass for twins.
answer2_variations.ja: うん、双子で通るくらい似てるよ。

vocab.meaning: 親戚関係にある、血縁の

question1.en: Do you still live with your parents?
question1.ja: まだ両親と一緒に住んでるの？

answer1_variations.en: Yes, I'm saving money for a house.
answer1_variations.ja: うん、家を買うためにお金を貯めてるんだ。

answer1_variations.en: No, I moved out when I was 18.
answer1_variations.ja: ううん、18歳の時に家を出たよ。

answer1_detail.en: Rent in the city is just too expensive.
answer1_detail.ja: 都会の家賃は高すぎるからね。

question2.ja: ご両親は気にしてない？

answer2_variations.en: They love having me around.
answer2_variations.ja: 彼らは私がいるのを喜んでくれてるよ。

answer2_variations.en: They keep asking when I'm leaving.
answer2_variations.ja: いつ出て行くのかって聞かれ続けてるよ。

question1.en: How often do you see your family?
question1.ja: どのくらいの頻度で家族に会う？

answer1_variations.en: We try to get together every Sunday.
answer1_variations.ja: 毎週日曜日に集まるようにしてるよ。

answer1_variations.en: Only once or twice a year.
answer1_variations.ja: 年に1、2回だけかな。

answer1_detail.en: They live on the other side of the country.
answer1_detail.ja: 彼らは国の反対側に住んでるから。

answer2_variations.en: Terribly. Video calls aren't the same.
answer2_variations.ja: すごくね。ビデオ通話じゃ物足りないよ。

answer2_variations.en: I'm okay. I enjoy my independence.
answer2_variations.ja: 平気だよ。自立を楽しんでるし。

question1.en: Were your parents strict growing up?
question1.ja: 子供の頃、親は厳しかった？

answer1_variations.en: Very. I had a curfew until college.
answer1_variations.ja: すごくね。大学まで門限があったよ。

answer1_variations.en: Not really, they were pretty laid-back.
answer1_variations.ja: そうでもないよ、かなりおおらかだった。

answer1_detail.en: They were obsessed with my grades.
answer1_detail.ja: 彼らは私の成績にうるさかったんだ。

answer2_variations.en: A little bit in high school.
answer2_variations.ja: 高校の時にちょっとね。

answer2_variations.en: No, I was a goody-two-shoes.
answer2_variations.ja: ううん、いい子ちゃんだったから。

vocab.meaning: おおらかな、のんびりした

question1.en: Are you married?
question1.ja: 結婚していますか？

answer1_variations.en: Yes, we've been married for 5 years.
answer1_variations.ja: はい、結婚して5年になります。

answer1_variations.en: No, I'm single and loving it.
answer1_variations.ja: いいえ、独身でそれを楽しんでます。

answer1_detail.en: We actually just got engaged last month.
answer1_detail.ja: 実は先月婚約したばかりなんです。

question2.ja: おめでとう！結婚式はいつ？

answer2_variations.en: We haven't set a date yet.
answer2_variations.ja: まだ日取りは決めてないんだ。

answer2_variations.en: We're planning for next spring.
answer2_variations.ja: 来年の春を予定してるよ。

question1.en: Do you have any kids?
question1.ja: お子さんはいますか？

answer1_variations.en: Yes, I have two boys.
answer1_variations.ja: はい、男の子が二人います。

answer1_variations.en: Not yet, maybe in the future.
answer1_variations.ja: まだです、将来的には欲しいけど。

answer1_detail.en: They are a handful but very cute.
answer1_detail.ja: 手がかかるけど、すごく可愛いですよ。

answer2_variations.en: They are 3 and 5.
answer2_variations.ja: 3歳と5歳です。

answer2_variations.en: One is in college already.
answer2_variations.ja: 一人はもう大学生です。

vocab.meaning: 手がかかる子、手に余るもの

question1.en: What does your father do?
question1.ja: お父さんは何をされているの？（職業は？）

answer1_variations.en: He's an engineer at a car company.
answer1_variations.ja: 自動車会社のエンジニアだよ。

answer1_variations.en: He's retired now.
answer1_variations.ja: 今はもう引退（退職）してるよ。

answer1_detail.en: He loves gardening in his free time.
answer1_detail.ja: 暇なときはガーデニングをするのが好きなんだ。

question2.ja: 引退生活を楽しんでる？

answer2_variations.en: He's busier now than when he worked!
answer2_variations.ja: 働いてた時より今の方が忙しそうだよ！

answer2_variations.en: He seems a bit bored, honestly.
answer2_variations.ja: 正直、ちょっと退屈そうだね。

question1.en: Do you have a big extended family?
question1.ja: 親戚は多いほう？

answer1_variations.en: Huge. I have like 20 cousins.
answer1_variations.ja: すごく多いよ。いとこが20人くらいいるし。

answer1_variations.en: No, it's just my parents and me.
answer1_variations.ja: ううん、両親と私だけだよ。

answer1_detail.en: Family reunions are absolute chaos.
answer1_detail.ja: 親戚の集まりは完全にカオスだよ。

answer2_variations.en: It is, there's always so much food.
answer2_variations.ja: 楽しいよ、いつも食べ物が山ほどあるし。

answer2_variations.en: It can be overwhelming sometimes.
answer2_variations.ja: 時々圧倒されちゃうけどね。

question1.en: Does musical talent run in your family?
question1.ja: あなたの家族は音楽の才能がある家系？

answer1_variations.en: Yes, my mom is a piano teacher.
answer1_variations.ja: うん、母はピアノの先生なんだ。

answer1_variations.en: No, we are all tone-deaf.
answer1_variations.ja: ううん、私たちはみんな音痴だよ。

answer1_detail.en: My grandfather played in a jazz band.
answer1_detail.ja: 祖父はジャズバンドで演奏してたんだ。

answer2_variations.en: I play the guitar a little.
answer2_variations.ja: ギターを少し弾くよ。

answer2_variations.en: I tried the violin but gave up.
answer2_variations.ja: バイオリンを試したけど諦めたよ。

vocab.meaning: （遺伝的形質などが）家族に伝わる

question1.en: How are your in-laws?
question1.ja: 義理の家族（配偶者の家族）とはどう？

answer1_variations.en: They are wonderful, very supportive.
answer1_variations.ja: 素晴らしい人たちだよ、とても協力的だし。

answer1_variations.en: We have a bit of a strained relationship.
answer1_variations.ja: ちょっと緊張感のある関係かな。

answer1_detail.en: My mother-in-law treats me like her own son.
answer1_detail.ja: 義母は私を実の息子のように扱ってくれるんだ。

answer2_variations.en: I know, I hear so many horror stories.
answer2_variations.ja: だよね、恐ろしい話をたくさん聞くからさ。

answer2_variations.en: It makes holidays much easier.
answer2_variations.ja: おかげで休暇がすごく楽だよ。

vocab.meaning: 緊張した、ぴりぴりした

question1.en: Are you the oldest or the youngest?
question1.ja: あなたは一番上？それとも末っ子？

answer1_variations.en: I'm the baby of the family.
answer1_variations.ja: 私は家族の中で一番下（末っ子）だよ。

answer1_variations.en: I'm the oldest of four.
answer1_variations.ja: 4人兄弟の一番上だよ。

answer1_detail.en: I got away with everything growing up.
answer1_detail.ja: 子供の頃は何をしても許されたんだ。

question2.ja: 兄弟はそれを恨んでる？

answer2_variations.en: They joke about it all the time.
answer2_variations.ja: 彼らはいつもそれをネタにしてるよ。

answer2_variations.en: Yeah, they say I was spoiled.
answer2_variations.ja: うん、私が甘やかされてたって言うよ。

vocab.meaning: （悪いことをしても）罰せられない、うまくやる

question1.en: Did you have to do chores as a kid?
question1.ja: 子供の頃、家事をしなきゃいけなかった？

answer1_variations.en: Yes, washing dishes was my job.
answer1_variations.ja: うん、皿洗いが僕の仕事だったよ。

answer1_variations.en: Not really, my mom did everything.
answer1_variations.ja: あんまり。母が全部やってくれてたから。

answer1_detail.en: My allowance depended on it.
answer1_detail.ja: お小遣いはそれにかかってたんだ。

question2.en: Do you think that was good for you?
question2.ja: それは自分のためになったと思う？

answer2_variations.en: Definitely, it taught me responsibility.
answer2_variations.ja: 間違いなくね。責任感を学べたよ。

answer2_variations.en: I hated it then, but I appreciate it now.
answer2_variations.ja: 当時は嫌いだったけど、今は感謝してる。

question1.en: Are you going home for the holidays?
question1.ja: 休暇には実家に帰るの？

answer1_variations.en: I can't this year because of work.
answer1_variations.ja: 今年は仕事があるから無理なんだ。

answer1_variations.en: Yes, I already booked my flight.
answer1_variations.ja: うん、もう飛行機を予約したよ。

answer1_detail.en: My mom is going to be so disappointed.
answer1_detail.ja: 母がすごくがっかりするだろうな。

answer2_variations.en: Of course, on New Year's Eve.
answer2_variations.ja: もちろん、大晦日にね。

answer2_variations.en: Yeah, we'll open gifts together online.
answer2_variations.ja: うん、オンラインで一緒にプレゼントを開けるよ。

question1.en: Who is the breadwinner in your family?
question1.ja: あなたの家の稼ぎ頭は誰？

answer1_variations.en: My dad works, and my mom is a homemaker.
answer1_variations.ja: 父が働いていて、母は専業主婦だよ。

answer1_variations.en: Both my parents work full-time.
answer1_variations.ja: 両親ともフルタイムで働いてるよ。

answer1_detail.en: It's becoming more common for both to work.
answer1_detail.ja: 共働きが一般的になってきてるよね。

question2.ja: じゃあ料理は誰がするの？

answer2_variations.en: They take turns.
answer2_variations.ja: 交代でやってるよ。

answer2_variations.en: Usually my dad, actually.
answer2_variations.ja: 実はたいてい父がやるんだ。

question1.en: Are you twins?
question1.ja: あなたたち、双子なの？

answer1_variations.en: Yes, identical twins.
answer1_variations.ja: うん、一卵性双生児だよ。

answer1_variations.en: No, just brothers close in age.
answer1_variations.ja: ううん、ただ歳が近い兄弟なだけ。

answer1_detail.en: People mix us up all the time.
answer1_detail.ja: いつもみんなに間違えられるんだ。

answer2_variations.en: Sometimes we finish each other's sentences.
answer2_variations.ja: たまにお互いの言葉を補完し合うことはあるね。

answer2_variations.en: I wish! That would be cool.
answer2_variations.ja: あったらいいのに！それならかっこいいよね。

question1.en: Have you ever traced your family tree?
question1.ja: 家系図を調べたことはある？

answer1_variations.en: Yes, I found some interesting ancestors.
answer1_variations.ja: うん、面白い先祖を見つけたよ。

answer1_variations.en: No, but I've always wanted to.
answer1_variations.ja: ううん、でもずっとやってみたいと思ってる。

answer1_detail.en: Apparently, we have samurai blood.
answer1_detail.ja: どうやらサムライの血が流れてるらしいんだ。

answer2_variations.en: It explains why my dad is so serious.
answer2_variations.ja: 父がなんであんなに真面目なのか説明がつくよ。

answer2_variations.en: I want to visit where they lived.
answer2_variations.ja: 彼らが住んでた場所に行ってみたいな。

question1.en: My parents are getting a divorce.
question1.ja: 両親が離婚することになったんだ。

answer1_variations.en: I'm so sorry to hear that.
answer1_variations.ja: それは残念だね（お気の毒に）。

answer1_variations.en: Are you okay?
answer1_variations.ja: 大丈夫？

answer1_detail.en: It's probably for the best, they fight a lot.
answer1_detail.ja: たぶんそれが一番いいんだ、喧嘩ばかりしてるから。

question2.en: Will you stay with your mom or dad?
question2.ja: お母さんとお父さん、どっちと住むの？

answer2_variations.en: I'm old enough to live on my own.
answer2_variations.ja: もう一人暮らしできる年齢だからね。

answer2_variations.en: I'll stay with my mom for now.
answer2_variations.ja: とりあえず母さんと住むよ。

question1.en: Who is the black sheep of your family?
question1.ja: 家族の中の「厄介者（変わり者）」は誰？

answer1_variations.en: Definitely my uncle Bob.
answer1_variations.ja: 間違いなくボブおじさんだね。

answer1_variations.en: Honestly, I think it's me.
answer1_variations.ja: 正直、私だと思う。

answer1_detail.en: He travels the world and never settles down.
answer1_detail.ja: 彼は世界中を旅してて、全然落ち着かないんだ。

question2.ja: それは逆にかっこいいね。

answer2_variations.en: Yeah, I admire his freedom.
answer2_variations.ja: うん、彼の自由さには憧れるよ。

answer2_variations.en: My grandma doesn't think so.
answer2_variations.ja: おばあちゃんはそう思ってないけどね。

vocab.meaning: 厄介者、変わり者、面汚し

question1.en: Do you want to raise your kids in the city?
question1.ja: 子供は都会で育てたい？

answer1_variations.en: No, I want them to grow up in nature.
answer1_variations.ja: ううん、自然の中で育ってほしいな。

answer1_variations.en: Yes, for the educational opportunities.
answer1_variations.ja: うん、教育の機会があるからね。

answer1_detail.en: I had a great childhood in the countryside.
answer1_detail.ja: 田舎での子供時代は最高だったから。

answer2_variations.en: Maybe, but it's safer and quieter.
answer2_variations.ja: かもね、でも安全で静かだよ。

answer2_variations.en: You need a car for everything though.
answer2_variations.ja: 何をするにも車が必要だけどね。
